column4: Ok, I have slow program launches.  For instance, when I click Applications at the top, it works fine, then I point to Accessories then I click on Terminal.  I get a "Starting Terminal" box, on my "task bar", for 17 seconds...then that goes away, and I have nothing for another 12 seconds, then the terminal finally pops up...any ideas?
how much ram
2 gig
are you running compiz, awn or other cpu consuming widgets?
Hmmm, I'm really sure.  It's a stock install of Gutsy for the AMD64...
But I do seem to recall turning on compiz
can you open up a terminal and type top to see what is eating processes
Load Average: 0.51 0.39 0.24  pidgin is using 4%...that's the highest
that is odd; if you turn off compiz what are the results-- alt-f2 metacity --replace
It's a little bit faster...8 seconds of "Starting Terminal" Then 4 seconds of nothing
what video card and what driver for getting compiz more in sync--its good that it is faster but still waaaay too slow
GeForce 7300 GS 256MB PCI-E 16x, and how do I check the driver?
that is the exact same card I have and a slew of recent updates ruined my video, had to reinstall the drivers--are you able to view video no problem?
BTW, everything works perfectly fine once launched.
then there is a serious memory leak--and youtube not working has been fixed you just need to reinstall the flash plug in nonfree
Oh wonderful...
So how do I turn compiz back on?
alt f2 compiz --replace
Thanks
no worries ;]
which question you want answered first?
